explanation: This example demonstrates the parallel inheritance hierarchies code smell, where whenever we create a subclass for the Shape hierarchy (like Circle, Square, Triangle), we must also create a corresponding subclass for the ShapeRenderer hierarchy (like CircleRenderer, SquareRenderer, TriangleRenderer). This parallel class hierarchy increases maintenance burden because every time a new shape is added, corresponding renderer and factory classes must also be added. The solution is to use composition instead of inheritance, or merge these two hierarchies into one.
